title: Natural Deodorants: Why They’re Better for Your Body
author: Harish
excerpt: Natural deodorants respect the body’s ability to sweat while controlling odor with plant-based powders and antimicrobial oils. Learn how they work and what to avoid.
content:
Aluminium-Free & Body-Friendly

Natural deodorants do not block sweat but neutralize odor via absorbent powders and antimicrobial botanicals. Ayurveda encourages natural elimination, so deodorants that simply control smell (not sweat) are often preferred.

Key Ingredients to Look For

  • Arrowroot: Absorbs moisture gently.
  • Neem oil: Antimicrobial and soothing.
  • Essential Oils: Vetiver and lemon are cooling and Pitta-friendly.

Transition Period

Expect 1–3 weeks for your body to adjust. During this time, odor patterns can shift as the microbiome rebalances—this is normal.

When to Avoid

Those with sensitive skin may react to baking soda; choose low-soda formulas or baking-soda-free alternatives.

Shop Herbal Deodorant and opt for breathable, plant-based freshness.
